book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations

questions.question: Having successfully overcome a stressful situation once, how will the person react if placed in the same or similar situation a second time?
options: a. There will be little difference
b. He/she will know what is ahead and be already in a stressful condition thus stress will increase
c. He/she will feel more confident and therefore stress will reduce
d. It will depend on the individual

questions.question: How is performance affected by over and under arousal?
options: d. It will depend on the individual

questions.question: What is the purpose of the "sympathetic" nervous system?
options: a. To control the emotional response under stressful conditions
b. To control the effects of adrenalin
c. To return the body to homeostasis after the "fight or flee" syndrome
d. To prepare the body for "fight or flight"

questions.question: What is the purpose of the "parasympathetic" nervous system?
options: a. To prolong the body's mobilisation and return the body to normal after the "fight or flight" syndrome
b. To prepare the body for "fight or flee"
c. To direct the adrenalin to the correct organs of the body
d. To return the body to normal after an emotional response under stressful conditions

questions.question: What part of the body is affected with the vibration in the 4 to 10 Hz frequency range?
options: a. The brain plus there will be a headache
b. The chest plus there will be an abdominal pain
c. The respiration plus pains in the chest

questions.question: Define three methods of coping with stress:
options: a. action coping, forced coping, symptom directed coping
b. action coping, cognitive coping, symptom directed coping
c. slip coping, cognitive coping, symptom directed coping
d. slip coping, action coping, symptom directed coping

questions.question: Which of the following statements, with regard to the five major guidelines to prevent stress in the cockpit from affecting safety, are correct:
options: a. planned sleep patterns and use all crew resources
b. planned sleep patterns and keep it simple
c. use all crew resources and keep a good flight deck atmosphere
d. never give up - there is always a suitable response

questions.question: The best strategies to increase stress tolerance are:
options: a. planning, experience and self-control (fewer unexpected situations)

questions.question: Once the blood temperature rises above ........... the homeostatic mechanisms within the body can no longer cope.
A comfortable humidity for most people in normal clothing is:
In a dynamic situation, an additional stress factor (stressor) can be:
options: c. a moderate amount of noise
d. the operation of the parasympathetic system

questions.question: The "break point" is:
options: a. when the pilot "overloads" due to stress
b. the point in time when the pilot is unable to think positively
c. the point in time when the pilot is unable to think rationally
d. the point of optimum performance after which, if stress continues, performance will be degraded
